# GitHub Copilot Instructions - Otakudesu Clone Project

## Design Principles
- Professional, minimalist, human-designed aesthetic
- NO glowing gradients, robotic motifs, or flashy animations
- Inspired by: Vercel, Supabase, Linear, Notion, Otakudesu

## Behavior Rules
- Document only important updates
- Keep responses direct, minimal, professional
- No fluff, emojis, or filler text
- Maintain design consistency

## Git Commit & Push Rules
- Always push after completing a task or stable update
- Use clear, concise commit messages
- Commit message format: <TYPE>: <short description>
- Types:  
  - FEAT → new feature  
  - FIX → bug fix  
  - REFACTOR → code or structure improvement  
  - STYLE → design/UI/UX changes  
  - DOCS → documentation or text updates  
  - CHORE → minor maintenance, cleanup, config
- Example: `FIX: resolve navbar overlap issue`
- No emojis or unnecessary tags
- Keep commits atomic (1 purpose per commit)
- Push frequently to avoid merge conflicts

## Project Specifications
- PHP 8.1+ native (no framework)
- MySQL 8.0 database
- Bootstrap 5 + Custom CSS
- Video.js for embed player
- Font Awesome for icons
- Manual content upload (no user registration)
- Embed video links only (no direct uploads)
- Responsive design following documented specifications

## Development Guidelines
- Follow exact measurements and colors from otakudesu-clone.txt
- Implement all documented components and layouts
- Maintain consistent coding standards
- Test functionality before committing
- Focus on clean, maintainable code
